data.title: Larry Miller to Perform at Cody Comedy Festival
data.meta_description: One of Hollywood’s most recognizable faces, Larry Miller, will perform stand-up at the annual Cody Comedy Festival on Wednesday, October 20, at 8:00 pm on the Staller Center stage. The event will benefit the Cody Center for Autism and Developmental Disabilities at Stony Brook University Medical Center, Long Island’s primary resource for information and research
data.meta_site_name: SBU News - News & Features at Stony Brook University
data.text:
One of Hollywood’s most recognizable faces, Larry Miller, will perform stand-up at the annual Cody Comedy Festival on Wednesday, October 20, at 8:00 pm on the Staller Center stage. The event will benefit the Cody Center for Autism and Developmental Disabilities at Stony Brook University Medical Center, Long Island’s primary resource for information and research on autism and related disorders.

A recognized Hollywood actor, comedian, and best-selling author, Miller began his career with a memorable cameo as the fawning store manager in the movie Pretty Woman. He has gone on to delight audiences in movies such as Best in Show, Waiting for Guffman, 10 Things I Hate About You, and The Nutty Professor I and II. He has had roles on hit television shows such as Boston Legal, 8 Simple Rules, Law & Order, and Seinfeld.

Miller has starred in several of his own comedy shows on HBO and on Broadway. He has also made regular appearances on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, The Late Show with David Letterman, and Real Time with Bill Maher. Miller wrote the best-selling book Spoiled Rotten America.
